Articles.Content: Does anybody know how to get precisely GPS coordinates of missions objectives like land somewhere or take surface samples? I need it fo mechjeb landing autopilot.

Can't it "land at" or "fly to" a target?

I don't know if [Waypoint Manager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/94432-105-waypoint-manager-v243-2015-11-09/#comment-1613211) actually displays the lat/long of the waypoints, but that's the mod I think is most likely to have what you're looking for.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T12:07:20Z" title="11/30/2015 12:07  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by DeMatt**
  
New forum formatting.
Sadly the Waypoint Manager does not show raw coordinates of objectives.

Dunno how to get exact coordinates, but MJ's 'pick target on map' function is pretty accurate. To improve accuracy, focus on the planet and set the camera so the target in in the middle of the screen. If it feels off, you can correct it by clicking a few pixels apart.

Even if it was multiple targets close to each other, MJ took me close enough to all of them to do each with a quick eva.
I know what you mean. But in real solar system mod is Earth ten times bigger so accuracy of MJ 'pick target on map' is ten times worst. Maybe something allowing bigger map zoom would help.
